intro: Lachemilla guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemala stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a houseplant. Lachemilla guatemalensis is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and minimal water requirements.
